dc_description_s: This layer describes the general distribution of surficial sediments in Minnesota, as delineated and classified by the Minnesota Geological Survey. It is a digital version of the Minnesota Geological Survey State Map Series Map S-1 (Geologic Map of Minnesota: Quaternary Geology), 1982, by H.C. Hobbs and J.E. Goebel. (1:500,000). The digital file was created by scanning the 1:500,000-scale paper map and then converting the scanned image into an Arc/INFO polygon coverage. In 2008 MGS converted the original linework to a shapefile format and added more descriptive fields based on the Quaternary Geology Code. File geodatabase format was created for the Minnesota Geospatial Commons.
dc_creator_sm: Minnesota Geological Survey (MGS) and Minnesota Geospatial Information Office (MnGeo)
dc_relation_sm: Map:  'Geologic Map of Minnesota: Quaternary Geology', Minnesota Geological Survey Map S-1, 1982, J.C. Hobbs and J.E. Goebel, is the basis for this data layer. For a complete listing of MGS State Map Series Maps, Reports, and GIS Data, see http://conservancy.umn.edu/handle/11299/59725U of M Digital Conservancy information on this map is at http://conservancy.umn.edu/handle/11299/60085
dc_title_s: Geologic Map of Minnesota - Quaternary Geology, (MGS Map S-1), 1982
